Title: Cloud&DevOps Consultant
Job Description: DevOps Implementation: Senior Cloud/DevOps Consultants are often responsible for implementing DevOps practices within organizations. This includes promoting collaboration between development and operations teams, automating software delivery pipelines, and implementing infrastructure as code (IaC) techniques. | Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD): They design and implement CI/CD pipelines to automate the deployment of applications and infrastructure changes. This accelerates development and release cycles, leading to faster time-to-market and reduced errors. | Automation: They create automation scripts and tools to streamline infrastructure provisioning, configuration management, and application deployment. This can involve using tools like Ansible, Terraform, Puppet, or Chef. | Security and Compliance: They implement security best practices and compliance measures to protect cloud resources and data. This may involve setting up identity and access management (IAM) policies, encryption, and ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations. | Cost Optimization: Consultants help organizations manage cloud costs effectively by analyzing usage, optimizing resource allocation, and implementing cost-saving strategies. They may also recommend Reserved Instances or Savings Plans. | Troubleshooting and Support: In their role, consultants often assist with identifying and resolving technical issues and providing support during critical incidents. | Overall, the specific responsibilities may differ depending on the demands of the organization and the consultant's skill. These individuals should be well-versed in cloud platforms, DevOps processes, automation technologies, and the ability to successfully engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Their objective is to accelerate organizational change, increase operational efficiency, and enable more agile and responsive development and operations processes.
Job Requirements: Cloud Infrastructure Design: They work with clients to design and architect cloud infrastructure solutions that align with business goals, cost-efficiency, and performance requirements. This may involve selecting the right cloud service providers (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), designing network architectures, and ensuring security and compliance. | Monitoring and Scaling: Senior Cloud/DevOps Consultants set up monitoring and alerting systems to track the performance and health of applications and infrastructure. They ensure that systems can scale dynamically to handle fluctuations in traffic or demand. | Training and Knowledge Transfer: They provide training and mentorship to in-house teams to build expertise in cloud technologies and DevOps practices, enabling the organization to become more self-sufficient over time. | Documentation and Best Practices: They document configurations, processes, and best practices to ensure that the organization has a clear and accessible reference for its cloud and DevOps operations. | Stay Current with Technology: Staying up-to-date with the latest cloud and DevOps tools, services, and best practices is crucial for a Senior Cloud/DevOps Consultant to provide relevant guidance and recommendations. | Excellent communication abilities | Extensive experience with large-scale Linux-based distributed systems | AWS or another cloud provider experience | Experience with large-scale SQL and/or NoSQL databases | Experience with the lifetime of services and monitoring | Experience in Cloud-Native and Kubernetes and CNCF projects | Knowledge of DevOps practices and culture | An attitude toward automation | A thorough knowledge of Kubernetes | Terraform or other IaC tool experience | Work from anywhere and anytime concept | Remote budget which you can buy whatever required to increase your efficiency at your home working area | Hackathon Days | Access to AWS and CNCF/Kubernetes Trainings | AWS and Kubernetes certifications | R&D focus | Weekly Lunch & Learn Sessions | Weekly Happy Fridays | Virtual Socials | Online Games

Job Requirements: Menguji fitur-fitur produk untuk memastikan bahwa semua fungsinya bekerja sesuai dengan spesifikasi yang telah ditentukan. | Menjalankan berbagai tes fungsional untuk memastikan setiap bagian dari produk (misalnya, tombol, form, atau fitur interaktif) berfungsi dengan baik. | Menguji produk di berbagai perangkat, browser, dan sistem operasi untuk memastikan bahwa produk berfungsi dengan baik di berbagai kondisi. | Melakukan regression testing untuk memastikan bahwa perbaikan tersebut tidak menyebabkan masalah baru pada bagian lain dari produk yang sebelumnya sudah berfungsi dengan baik. | Pengujian penerimaan pengguna (UAT), bekerja sama dengan pengguna untuk memastikan bahwa produk memenuhi harapan dan kebutuhan mereka sebelum dirilis. | Minimal pendidikan S1 Jurusan Teknik Informatika / Komputer | Diutamakan memahami business process perbankan. | Mampu melaksanakan pengujian (minimal SIT, UAT) sesuai skenario yang telah ditetapkan, baik secara manual maupun automation testing. | Memiliki pengalaman kerja minimal 1 tahun diperbankan. | Memiliki kemampuan untuk berpikir kritis dan analitis, menemukan masalah atau bug dalam produk, dan dapat menjelaskan langkah-langkah untuk mereproduksi masalah tersebut. | Mampu menyusun laporan bug dengan jelas dan terstruktur, menjelaskan secara rinci tentang masalah, langkah-langkah yang diperlukan untuk mereproduksi, dan kemungkinan dampaknya.

Title: Merchandising Manager (Apparel)
Job Description: Sustain good relationship with both internal and external parties in order to achieve overall development/production schedule and on-time delivery | Work on cost planning analysis to achieve the right costing that meet with the customer’s expectations
Job Requirements: Proactively work with the fellow merchandising team, customers, vendors / factories and cross functional teams to ensure products are of high quality | Monitor and supervise order follow up with subordinates, resolve production issues, ensure on time delivery and quality that meet the requirements | Work on risk assessment through production process | Provide on-the-job training and coaching for subordinates on product knowledge upgrade, merchandising skills and overall effectiveness | University graduate in Textile / Clothing or related discipline | At least 8 years’ solid experience in garment trading field; experience in USA market is preferable | Solid experience in managing offshore vendors | Strong aggressiveness in leading and achieving high vision, capable to handle different levels of counterparts / stakeholders in driving business goals | Self-motivated, strong managerial skills and negotiation ability | Excellent problem-solving skills and good time management | Excellent command of both written and spoken English | Proficient in Microsoft Office – Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook | Occasional business travel is expected

Title: Field CTO / Tech Evangelist, Indonesia
Job Description: Stakeholder management & collaboration across the region
Job Requirements: Build and deliver world-class lending solutions in the lending | Take full ownership of the product portfolio, conceptualizing, planning, building, and managing end-user experiences related to the product | Ensure the tech team understands the specifications to deliver a quality product | Ensure optimal user experience, security & compliance with regulations | Be the voice of the user and advocate for customer-first products while moving the needle on high-impact problem spaces | Understand the evolving needs and challenges of the consumer and merchants, and tailor the product to meet those needs | drive product decisions using data analytics, A/B testing, and user insights to achieve measurable outcomes. | At least 8 years of hands-on experience working with tech & business teams, with expertise in lending credit systems and functional systems, including but not limited to onboarding flow, transaction system, and 3rd party platform services integration etc. | Familiar with the industry's best software solutions | Knowledge about PDLC and experience at various stages, including testing, UI/UX design | Good understanding of the lending and back-end system architecture | Good communication skills are required to communicate with regional stakeholders | Fluent communication in English is a must

Title: Process Engineer
Job Description: Gathers and analyze the benchmark of leasing strategies, and stays up to date with the new brands to the market.
Job Requirements: Bachelor Degree from any major | Having a minimum of 4-6 years working experience as a Leasing Coordinator in retail or shopping mall. | Proficiency in computer especially Microsoft Office. General IT proficiency | Excellent in English, both written and spoken. | Having a networking and knowledge with F&B Brands. | Proactive and eager to learn. | Conducts tenancy negotiation with prospective tenants to achieve department occupancy target rate. | Prepare all documentation during leasing process: rental calculation, Offer to Lease, Lease agreement application, and other leasing issues that associated with the tenant as per the set SOP within department. | Supervises the processing and approval of client and lease assignment or lease termination on the unperformed tenant, tenancy mix, and opening of the leased unit. | Handling leasing inquiries, maintaining the database and keeping records of all communication (MOM). | Provides and maintains superior client service for maximum client satisfaction.

Title: Account Executive
Job Description: Min. bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or Management.
Job Requirements: Min. 1 year of working experience in Sales & Marketing field | Experienced in handle Government/ BUMN/ Banking, Finance & Mining/ Brand client would be a plus point | Interested in sales field | Fine with high mobilization | Attractive personality, honest, and able to work under pressure | Have a good communication and negotiation skills | Able to work in team

Title: Fullstack Developer (Banking Industry)
Job Description: Familiar with Agile software development, microservice and containerization
Job Requirements: Develop, deploy & implement applications based on system design, standard, quality, and performance from requirements | Do research and assessment based on requirement for further enhancement | Support production inquiries, and do investigation to have Root Cause Analysis for production issues | Experience with Mobile and Web Application Development minimum 1 years | Experience with Programming Java with OOP concept | Experience and understanding with technology stack & Framework: | Back end: NodeJS, Express, GraphQL | Front end: React & React Native | Database: NoSQL | Unit Test: JEST | Experience with development corporate internet banking (cash management) is a plus | Have integrity, initiative and detail. | Have a high commitment to complete work on time | Able to work under pressure | Have a good adaptability and fast learning

Title: Customer Experience Manager
Job Description: Analyze customer feedback, journey mapping, and data insights to identify areas for improvement. | Lead the development of training programs to ensure all employees deliver exceptional customer service.
Job Requirements: Develop and execute customer experience strategies that align with company goals. | Collaborate with cross-functional teams to address customer pain points and implement solutions. | Monitor and measure the effectiveness of customer experience initiatives and provide regular reports. | Serve as a customer advocate, ensuring their needs are prioritized in business decisions. | Stay informed about industry trends and innovations to enhance the customer experience. | Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field. | Minimum of 5 years of experience in customer experience management, customer service, or related roles. | Strong understanding of customer journey mapping and experience design principles. | Excellent analytical skills to interpret customer data and derive actionable insights. | Proven ability to lead and inspire teams to deliver exceptional service. | Exceptional communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills. | Familiarity with CRM tools and customer feedback platforms is preferred. | Willingness and ability to relocate to Purbalingga for onsite work. | A strong customer-first mindset with the ability to balance customer needs and business goals. | Experience in the FMCG sector or related industries is a plus. | Strong organizational and project management skills to handle multiple initiatives.

Title: Content Creator
Job Description: Creative mindset with a passion for developing innovative and visually appealing content.
Job Requirements: 1-3 years of experience in content creation, preferably within a digital agency setting, with a focus on the beauty category. | Demonstrated ability to conceptualize, execute (shoot and produce), and edit engaging content specifically for TikTok. | Strong understanding of TikTok trends, features, and best practices for maximizing reach and engagement. | Proficiency in video editing software and mobile editing apps relevant to TikTok content creation. | Knowledge of beauty trends, products, and terminology. | Conceptualizing, shooting, and editing TikTok-first video content that aligns with brand guidelines and campaign objectives. | Staying up-to-date on the latest TikTok trends, challenges, and features to inform content creation. | Collaborating with creative and social media teams to ensure content strategy alignment. | Analyzing content performance and identifying opportunities for improvement. | Adapting TikTok content for other social media platforms as needed. | TikTok Content Creation | Video Shooting & Editing | Trend Awareness

Title: Community Manager (Global Audience)
Job Description: Responsible for the developing the global long term sustainability strategy together with stakeholders from sustainability teams, procurement, supply chain, finance, R&D, business groups and units for respect portfolios. | Translating strategy into delivery in designing respective impact programs to be run together with our suppliers and partners and bring strategy to life on the ground. | Initiate and drive large change management and value chain integration projects which enable our path to positive impact. | Proactively manage our relationships and key sustainability metrics with suppliers across the supply chain. | Lead and design the technology data provision partnerships to accelerate transparency and traceability of materials creating faster more effective pathways to drive, measure and manage impact. Leader in digital Innovation for nature, drive industry wide transparency. | Support Unilever in relationship management and engagement with key opinion formers and civil society. | Collaborate with the Climate and Nature team and across our business with external partners to develop our pipeline of co-financed projects and programs. | Lead and support Unilever’s response and preparedness to manage relevant regulatory changes that impact our supply chains and suppliers e.g. EUDR. | Effectively manage sustainability budgets and activity-based costing to ensure that we deliver our commitments making utmost effective use of resources and external partners. | Subject matter expertise and track record in leading sustainability program design for impact and managing a theory of change into implementation. | Subject matter expertise on peat management, high conservation value areas and high carbon stock. | Design of public private partnerships and multistakeholder collaborations at landscape level. | You are still responsible for your own results and as a manager, you also need to motivate others to deliver with passion, creating an inclusive and engaging climate around you. You can balance challenge with support and coaching. You understand the wider business context and you are emotionally intelligent enough to motivate people to deliver what is needed. | PERSONAL MASTERY: Sets high standards for themselves. Has emotional intelligence to take feedback, manage mood and motivations, and build empathy for others.
Job Requirements: Continuously benchmarking our approach with competitors and peers and tapping into external networks. Benchmarking against best practices – innovate and identify metrics, tools, and process to optimize sustainable sourcing, impact programs and efficiencies in delivering our goals – create the fuel for impact. | Lead and establish of the centres of excellence in sustainability at strategic integrated sites, like Unilever Oleochemicals Indonesia, intended to be the benchmark and lead the industry in the supply of sustainable tropical oils derivatives. | Build a collaborative team environment that constantly learns and builds best practice. | Leading the delivering of Unilever ‘s multi-year commitments and sustainability goals across Nature, Climate and Livelihoods within our Tropical Oils and Wood Based Packaging value chains - especially focusing on sustainable sourcing, deforestation and conversion free supply chains, decarbonisation of scope 3 and in particular our associated Forest and Land Use emissions (FLAG), enhancing livelihoods, protecting and restoring nature and regenerative agriculture. | Lead a global team running programs on the ground in key commodity sourcing areas as well as provide leadership on the agenda to key procurement teams across SEA, Latam, North America, Africa Middle East, South Asia and Northeast Asia. | Support our ambitions for expanding responsible and impactful direct sourcing and sustainable supply to Unilever Oleochemicals Indonesia. | Lead relationships across our key partners and programs with effective supplier communications and engagement in key programs. | Represent Unilever in key industry platforms being an advocate for industry impact. | Own the delivery of nature-based reporting as needed on deforestation and protect and restore programs including metrics and impact reporting. | Outstanding in idea generation, ideas that are forward thinking, and that contribute to creating sustained competitive advantage. | Strong at storytelling and selling ideas to his/her business partners, internally and externally, translating these into effective strategies, programs or proposals conveying long term value and communicating accordingly. | Appreciation of the value and impact of outstanding execution with a keen eye for detail – knows how to deliver through the business. | Act as an entrepreneur, treats business as his/her own, sets trends and is willing to lead or follow appropriately. | Behave as a Partner to Win ambassador and demonstrate the value sustainable procurement adds to the business through our supplier base. | Genuinely committed to Unilever’s sustainably lead business model, connected with the business groups, units and growth agenda. | At least 15+ years’ experience in Sustainability, Agriculture, Procurement or sustainability linked supply chain management. | Proven track record of implementing successful sustainability programs with positive impact and transformative results. | Expertise in sustainability as it pertains to the respective value chains upstream and downstream or, expertise in sustainability as it pertains to the other relevant value chains upstream and downstream. | Demonstrated and proven leadership capabilities to lead diverse regional or global teams and cross functionally. | Have the ‘gravitas’ (experience, self-awareness, and interpersonal skills), allowing them to interact with senior stakeholders effectively and efficiently across the company and externally. | Demonstrated capability in dialing up the different standards of leadership for high performance. | Advanced education in agroforestry, forestry, agronomy, business and agricultural economics, or related fields preferred. | Strategic sourcing, procurement portfolio strategy expertise | Experience in other similar commodities coupled with commercial acumen. | Experience in operations- end to end portfolio management. | Experience in cofinance of programs and projects. | Subject matter expertise on palm, tropical and liquid oils commodities and/or wood-based value chains. | Subject matter expertise in decarbonisation of supply chains, environmental sustainability, deforestation and conversion free value chains, conservation and restoration, regenerative agriculture, social sustainability, livelihoods programs and strategy. | Engagement and influencing skills on a senior level. | Negotiation skills, communications skills, | Digital and analytics knowledge for reporting capabilities on sustainability. | Financial and business acumen for business cases and reporting. | International business and leadership experience, good interpersonal and storytelling skills for business influencing. | You are an inclusive motivator of people. Your team deliver with real passion, growing and learning from each other whilst delivering quick wins. | Critical SOL (Standards of Leadership) Behaviors | PASSION FOR HIGH PERFORMANCE: Generates intensity and focus to motivate people to deliver results at speed. Takes personal responsibility and accountability for execution and results. | TALENT CATALYST: Invests in people – coaches individuals and teams to realize their full potential. Creates an inclusive climate, empowering everyone to be at their best. | PURPOSE & SERVICE: Has humility, understanding that leadership is service to others, inside and outside Unilever. | CONSUMER LOVE: Invests time inside and outside to understand the needs of consumers. | BUSINESS ACUMEN: Creates sustainable growth with purpose, engaging different partners across the system for change.

Job Description: Check and analyze ordering from SC Category fit to budget and Stock Level Target | Collaborate the planning and execution of stock opname activities with related stakeholders | Ensure product stock is adequate for all distribution channels and liaise with demand planning team to ensure can cover direct demand from customers
Job Requirements: Collaborate with related stakeholders for rebalancing stock | Processes return as required, following established procedures. | Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration. | Minimum 2 years working experience as an Inventory Management Associate. | Proficiency in Ms. Office preferably Ms. Excel. | Knowledge of apparel inventory control. | Knowledge of, or ability to learn quickly, numerous computerized systems used to track and process inventory.

Title: Engineering Head
Job Description: Familiarity with risk assessment methods (e.g., HAZOP, FMEA, SIL), and project management tools (SAP, Oracle, Primavera, etc.) | Serve as the single point of accountability for all Engineering deliverables, design quality, and compliance with internal and regulatory standards. | Lead all Engineering Management phases: from licensor engagement, design standardization, FEED oversight, detailed design, procurement support, construction engineering, to pre-commissioning. | Ensure the development and enforcement of Engineering Design Standards, drawing from licensor input, PT ESSA lessons learned, and international best practices. | Align Engineering outputs with Operations & Maintenance goals through early engagement and design-for-operability approach. | Promote knowledge transfer and capacity-building through coaching and succession planning.
Job Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Engineering (Mechanical preferred); Master’s degree or Chartered Engineer certification is an advantage | Minimum 20 years of experience in oil & gas, refining, or petrochemical industries, with at least 12 years in Engineering Leadership roles across the full project lifecycle | Proven track record in leading multidisciplinary engineering teams in FEED, EPC, and site construction | Start-up and operational readiness experience in petrochemical or refining facilities is essential | Demonstrated experience in setting and enforcing Engineering Standards, Quality Assurance, and HSSEQ integration | Strong leadership, stakeholder management, and communication capabilities, including experience working with international teams | Ability to balance strategic oversight with hands-on problem-solving in a fast-paced project environment | Set the strategic vision for Engineering within the SAF Project, ensuring alignment with overall project objectives and O&M requirements. | Act as a technical authority and escalation point for all discipline leads under Engineering, excluding Process. | Establish and drive Engineering KPIs, reporting structures, and performance reviews to ensure alignment with project timelines and budget. | Oversee technical content of MRs, vendor selection, and field engineering practices to ensure quality and fit-for-purpose outcomes. | Engage closely with the Project Director, Head of Projects, and cross-functional PMT members to drive integrated project decisions. | Liaise with licensors, FEED/EPC/PMC contractors, vendors, and external authorities for timely engineering approvals and coordination. | Build and mentor a high-performing engineering team capable of executing complex project scopes under stringent safety and quality expectations.

Title: Landscape Supervisor
Job Description: Maintain all plants in both indoor and outdoor areas. | Develop work plan, maintenance, and supervision of all Landscape Department work and equipment related to Green House, Outdoor Garden (Area, Sidewalk, Planter Box, etc), Indoor Garden (Mini Garden, Container Garden, Seating Area, etc). | Regularly check the work program schedule and recapitulation of Landscape vendor reports that have been made including: Daily Work Plan, Weekly Work Plan, Biweekly Work Plan, Monthly Work Plan and Annual Work Plan. | Regularly develop and review the work program schedule of landscape vendors, including: general maintenance, periodic maintenance, and preventive maintenance.
Job Requirements: Supervise and coordinate with landscape vendors regarding field findings and control all landscape areas

Title: Product Designer
Job Description: Design user flows, wireframes, and high-fidelity UI for web and mobile platforms. | Synthesize findings to inform design decisions. | Collaborate with stakeholders to gather feedback and iterate designs. | Use and contribute to existing design system components. | Work with Product Managers, Engineers, and other stakeholders to align on user and business needs. | Prepare and document designs for development. | Support developers during implementation to ensure design accuracy. | Review design performance and iterate based on data and feedback. | Stay updated with design trends and tools. | Bachelor’s degree in industrial design, product design, visual communication design, fine arts, or relevant discipline. | Skill in designing user journeys, flows, wireframes, and prototypes based on user needs. | Ability to create interactive prototypes to communicate design ideas and validate interactions. | Ability to apply and contribute to existing design systems for consistency. | Strong analytical thinking to identify user pain points and propose effective design solutions. | Effective communication & teamwork with product managers, developers, researchers, and other designers.
Job Requirements: Ensure intuitive and consistent user experiences. | Conduct user research and usability testing. | Create interactive prototypes for validation. | Ensure visual and functional consistency across platforms. | Have 2–4 years of experience in UI/UX design or product design, working on digital platforms such as web and mobile applications. | Experience in collaborating with cross-functional teams, applying user-centered design principles, and contributing to design systems is preferred. | Ability to create clean, consistent, and user-friendly interfaces. | Skill in conducting interviews, surveys, and usability tests to gather user insights.

Title: Accounts Payable Accountant (6-Month Contract) - Middle East Team
Job Description: To supervise and lead the staffs in an efficient and effective manner in the performance of the daily finance operational functions. Develop clear strategies and clearly communicate objectives, updates and information to the team.
Job Requirements: Review, verify and reconcile Invoices from Vendors and employee expense claims ensuring these are coded into correct GL accounts and cost centers, and are paid according to due dates. | Ensure proper 3 way match is done for invoices processed by staff. Review of POs or contracts/agreements to ensure this is same with Goods Receipt and the Invoice from vendors. | Monitor and follow up recurring expenses and other ad hoc expenses to be used for accrual during month-end closing. | Preparation and control of AP Reporting Package including Aging Reports. | Implement and ensure compliance to AP policies and procedures. | Interface with Users, provide support to the business by responding to queries and addressing AP concerns in a timely manner. | Perform other duties as may be requested from time to time | Bachelor's Degree in Finance or Accounting. | At least 4 years work experience in Finance & Accounting preferably in Accounts Payable. MNC experience is a plus | Should possess strong skills in Excel Applications and knowledge of ERP accounting software such Oracle is preferred | Analytical, organized, accurate and with strong attention to details. | Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbally. | Ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic environment where adaptability is imperative.

Job Description: Manages the development of a strategic account plan for the demand generators in the market. | Manages the property's reactive and proactive sales efforts. | Determines and develops marketing communication activities, in conjunction with Regional Marketing Communications. | Suggests innovative marketing ideas and develops deployment strategies to continue to grow market share. | partnerships with local organizations to further increase brand/product awareness. | Develops and manages internal key stakeholder relationships. | Develops strong community and public relations by collateral to drive revenue and meet property objectives.

program/event. | Functions as the leader of the property’s sales department for properties with bookings over 300 peak rooms and significant local catering revenue. | Executes the sales strategy in order to meet individual booking goals for both self and staff. | Verifies Sales team understands and is leveraging Marriott International (MI) demand engines to full potential. | Works with Human knowledge and develops group sales skills of other discipline managers. | Provides day to day leadership to sales associates to achieve property sales objectives with overall responsibility for achieving booking goals and property revenues.

Interface directly with the Client to understand and interpret the Client’s needs, the demands and changes within their broader business environment, and investigate and advocate how CBRE can best support the Client. | Primarily, the candidate will oversee the branch and office network working closely with the respective business in determining the retail distribution strategy for the bank. | Represent the client as the Tenant in leasing properties to support the business requirement of the client with or without appointed brokers. | Negotiate and working with the respective landlords including but limiting to government agencies to achieve the best price and conditions for the Client in new tenancy agreement, renewals, license reviews and termination of licenses. | Site inspection is required to determine the new location or renewal discussion. | Take ownership, track and update client and business that all transactions to ensure timely action taken within the lease and license period. | Adhere to the transaction process including approval and payment such as advance payments, security deposits, recurring rents, insurance charges and any other related costs to ensure minimal gaps and risks to the client | Conduct due diligence check on landlords in accordance with the account’s governance, risk and compliance policy | Support in the drafting and review of agreements, highlight any deviations or anomalies that may require engagement and approval from legal team and the Client | Generate the necessary POs for payment for agency fee and others. | Establish and maintain good landlord-tenant relationships and where applicable | Assist and support the client’s Asset Divestment program if any with the assistance from the appointed brokers to bring forth potential buyers for the properties adhering to the client’s divestment process. | Collaborate and maintain close reporting relationship with Account team in Singapore to provide highest level of service and consistency as per the Master Service Agreement | Work with relevant stakeholders in yearly budgeting exercise and review of valuer panel | Any other ad-hoc transaction activities to assist the team as a whole or as requested such as tax related issue, insurance and business permit assistance. | Qualifications in Business, Real Estate, or related discipline is desirable | Relevant lease transaction or landlord representative experience is preferred. | Good interpersonal skills with positive attitude | Strong communication and analytical skills (both verbal and written), with the ability to respond effectively to sensitive issues | Proactively managing customer relationships | Fluency in English and local language | Ability to work independently with minimal supervision in addition to being a team player | Proactive self-starter with a curious mind set to bring positive change to the team | Presents solutions to problems, escalating in a timely manner where necessary. | Client centric mind set and driving Customer Service Levels | Strong negotiation skills with good attention to details | Good time management and multitasking skills, (1) able to work with accuracy under pressure and meet deadlines and (2) start to show understanding on how to manage concurrent tasks in parallel and prioritize accordingly | Good analytical skills : qualitative and quantitative with reasonable presentation skills | Skilled in Microsoft excel and other Microsoft office tools | Sensitive to cross-cultural exposures

Present to cross-functional team and HQ for alignment and best practice sharing as needed. | Audit assigned Tier 2 and Tier 3 vendors for adherence to Brooks Vendor Manual. Job Requirements: Runner First | Word is Bond | Champion Heart | There is no “I” in Run | Keep Moving | Perform regular audits to ensure factories adherence to Brooks PFC, Brooks In-Station-Quality Standard, Standardized Work, category requirements, and other Brooks quality / packaging checklists | Provide In-Station-Quality (ISQ) training to factory QA representatives who then provide factory operator training.
